Description: A head, neck and chest, broken from a hollow terracotta figure of a racehorse. Adorned with elaborate garlands, and with incuse details of neck-harness. Modelled in the round, with hollow body, a hole is bored in the underside for a modern mount. Two-piece mould. Micaceous brown Nile silt, burnt black over a large area.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired in the Fayum. Roman, third or fourth century AD. Comparanda: Near: Allen 1985: nos 36 and 37, from Karanis, dated late third to early fourth century AD; Ashmolean Museum, Oxford, no. 1872.415, acquired by the vendor in the Fayum; Breccia 1926: pl. lxxi:1, 9 and 10, from Theadelphia.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3752)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
